EmailTemplate.subject: What if Pods Weren’t Bound to Nodes for Life?
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
<[[https://turbonomic.com/blog/on-turbonomic/kubernetes-rescheduling-with-turbonomic/]]> Hi {{lead.First Name:default=there}},
Left to their own devices, Kubernetes pods can die many slow deaths or never come to life, causing resource contention and affecting end-users. How do you avoid performance degradation in these scenarios?
<[[https://turbonomic.com/blog/on-turbonomic/kubernetes-rescheduling-with-turbonomic/]]>
Turbonomic determines the right node for the pod and will reschedule them when needed to prevent performance degradation while ensuring service is never disrupted.
Let’s chat <[[https://turbonomic.com/request-a-demo-container-platforms/]]> and discuss how we can help you and your organization achieve the full potential of container platforms.
Cheers,
Asena Woodward Sr. Product Marketing Manager, Turbonomic
